history.content:
Hi there,

Apologies if this has been answered before, but I couldn't find it in the search.

I just finished my first-semester of junior year and am switching from MCB to CS. I checked the "Change of Major?" option on the declaration page and submitted the Major Declaration petition (with an MCB adviser's signature). 

Was this the correct thing to do? The wording for getting an adviser's signature is a bit confusing because some places say the signature is from the "new major's" adviser which suggests I should get a CS adviser's signature on the petition. Other places say to get a signature from your current major advisers. Also someone told me I should check "Double Major" and then include a note that I am switching majors in the "Other" box, but that's confusing too because of the "Change Major?" option (why else would there be a "Change Major?" option.....)

Finally, I have completed about 60-70 units at Berkeley, but my transcript says ~110 units completed due to AP. The programming planning thing is mandatory for those who have completed > 90 units at Berkeley (not including AP), but I'm wondering whether advisers are able to see that I've only completed 60-70 Berkeley units and therefore do not need to complete the program planning form.

Thanks!
